review.title: Machine Learning Techniques for Intrusion Detection
review.abstract: An Intrusion Detection System (IDS) is a software that monitors a single or a network of computers for malicious activities (attacks) that are aimed at stealing or censoring information or corrupting network protocols. Most techniques used in today's IDS are not able to deal with the dynamic and complex nature of cyber attacks on computer networks. Hence, efficient adaptive methods like various techniques of machine learning can result in higher detection rates, lower false alarm rates and reasonable computation and communication costs. In this paper, we study several such schemes and compare their performance. We divide the schemes into methods based on classical artificial intelligence (AI) and methods based on computational intelligence (CI). We explain how various characteristics of CI techniques can be used to build efficient IDS.

sections.heading: 4.3 Fuzzy Logic
sections.text: Fuzzy logic is a method of calculation based on degree of truth rather than the usual true or false Boolean logic on which modern computers are based. Fuzzy logic allows an object to belong to different classes at the same time using fuzzy spaces. This makes fuzzy logic a good choice for detecting intruders because the security itself is blurred and the boundary between the normal and the anomaly is not well defined. Furthermore, the problem of intrusion detection involves many numerical attributes in collected data and various derived statistical metrics. Building models directly on numerical data usually causes high detection errors. A behavior that deviates only slightly from a model cannot be detected or a small change in normal behavior can cause a false positive. With fuzzy logic it is possible to model these small deviations in order to keep the false positive / negative rates small. An artificial immune system is a computer-aided system based on the behavior of natural immune systems. sections.heading: 5 Conclusion
sections.text: We reviewed several influential intrusion detection algorithms based on various machine learning techniques. Characteristics of ML techniques enable the development of IDS with high detection rates and low false positive rates, while the system quickly adapts to changing malicious behaviors. We divided these algorithms into two types of ML-based systems: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Computer Intelligence (CI).
